it.unimi.di.law.bubing.sieve

Interface ByteSerializerDeserializer<V>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ByteArrayListByteSerializerDeserializer, CharSequenceByteSerializerDeserializer

    public interface ByteSerializerDeserializer<V>
    A light for of serialization based on InputStream/OutputStream (and FastBufferedInputStream for fast skipping).

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static ByteSerializerDeserializer<byte[]> BYTE_ARRAY
      A serializer-deserializer for byte arrays that write the array length using variable-length byte encoding, and the writes the content of the array.
      static ByteSerializerDeserializer<Integer> INTEGER
      A trivial serializer-deserializer for Integer.
      static ByteSerializerDeserializer<Void> VOID
      A NOP-serializer-deserializer for Void (only for values).

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      V fromStream(InputStream is)
      Deserializes an object starting from a given portion of a byte array.
      void skip(FastBufferedInputStream is)
      Skip an object, usually without deserializing it.
      void toStream(V v, OutputStream os)
      Serializes an object starting from a given offset of a byte array.

    • Field Detail

      • VOID

        static final ByteSerializerDeserializer<Void> VOID
        A NOP-serializer-deserializer for Void (only for values).

      • INTEGER

        static final ByteSerializerDeserializer<Integer> INTEGER
        A trivial serializer-deserializer for Integer.

      • BYTE_ARRAY

        static final ByteSerializerDeserializer<byte[]> BYTE_ARRAY
        A serializer-deserializer for byte arrays that write the array length using variable-length byte encoding, and the writes the content of the array.

    • Method Detail

      • fromStream

        V fromStream(InputStream is)
             throws IOException
        Deserializes an object starting from a given portion of a byte array.
        Parameters:
        is - the input stream from which the object will be deserialized.
        Returns:
        a new object, deserialized from the given portion of the array.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • toStream

        void toStream(V v,
            OutputStream os)
              throws IOException
        Serializes an object starting from a given offset of a byte array.
        Parameters:
        v - the object to be serialized.
        os - the output stream that will receive the serialized object.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • skip

        void skip(FastBufferedInputStream is)
          throws IOException
        Skip an object, usually without deserializing it.

        Note that this method requires explicitly a FastBufferedInputStream. As a result, you can safely use skip() to skip the number of bytes required (see the documentation of FastBufferedInputStream.skip(long) for some elaboration).

        Calling this method must be equivalent to calling fromStream(InputStream) and discarding the result.

        Parameters:
        is - the fast buffered input stream from which the next object will be skipped.
        Throws:
        IOException
